oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: C.M. Hall of Fame Luncheon at the Governor's Mansion 1999-09-23 Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of the Country Music Hall of Fame Luncheon at the Governor's Mansion. The luncheon features a performance from Nathan Best (musician). Additionally, the luncheon features speakers: Kyle Young (C. M. president), Don Sundquist (governor), Marty Stuart (musician), Bruce Hilton, Sherry Bond, and Susan Bond. The luncheon is for the winners of the Country Music Association Awards and the opening of the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on 5th Ave. Nashville, Tennessee. The recording is from September 23, 1999. The tape is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Nathan Best; Don Sundquist; Kyle Young; Marty Stuart; Bruce Hilton; Sherry Bond; Susan Bond
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) God Has Smiled on Me (Nathan Best) -- (03:16) Don Sundquist greets the audience to the governor's mansion and the book associated to it -- (04:16) Sundquist reflects on the historical significance located within the governor's mansion -- (07:18) Sundquist praises the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum and presents the ideals of the new Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum location -- (09:44) Kyle Young gives recognition to musician Hank Snow while recognizing Kayton Roberts' contributions -- (10:57) Young praises Nathan Best, and the other members of the Fairfield Four, for their introduction into the Gospel Music Hall of Fame; additionally, Young mentions Randy Scruggs -- (12:23) Marty Stuart and Bruce Hinton expound the ideas of 'Mother's and Father's Day of Country Music' -- (13:38) Stuart recites a lyric from "Same Old Train" to describe his idea of the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (16:46) Stuart reflects on Willie nelson and Dolly Parton's experience when Roger Miller was inducted to the Country Hall of Fame and Museum -- (18:45) Young reflects on Johnny Bond's distinctive guitar styling -- (20:58) Sherry Bond invites her sister Susan Bond to join her on stage to help her describe the feeling of Bond being inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (24:15) Susan Bond reflects on Sherry and Johnny's showmanship -- (26:15) Stuart describes how Conway Twitty connected to him; additionally, Stuart reflects on Twitty's vast exploits
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Best, Nathan; Sundquist, Don; Young, Kyle; Hilton, Bruce; Bond, Sherry; Bond, Susan;
